text: Ok now we obviously need Henning Rousseau

elements.text: Ok now we obviously need Henning Rousseau

text:
So, what’s the deal with this person?  I googled the name, and saw that he had written a blog article on Medium, but he had already deleted it.  Just from the title alone, seems like provocative misguided clickbait.
Is he another person upset that Julia Computing exists, and is (hopefully) making money consulting etc. while *also* greatly helping the open source project Julia succeed?

elements.text:
So, what’s the deal with this person?  I googled the name, and saw that he had written a blog article on Medium, but he had already deleted it.  Just from the title alone, seems like provocative misguided clickbait.
Is he another person upset that Julia Computing exists, and is (hopefully) making money consulting etc. while
greatly helping the open source project Julia succeed?

text: We believe it is a sockpuppet of a disgruntled discourse poster. It was a whole drama last week.

elements.text: We believe it is a sockpuppet of a disgruntled discourse poster. It was a whole drama last week.

text: Oh, boy, I did read through that, somebody had suggested getting :popcorn: while reading it, which was a good idea!

elements.text: Oh, boy, I did read through that, somebody had suggested getting
while reading it, which was a good idea!

text: I just don’t get what the big deal is though.  Even as a consultant focusing on Julia, potentially competing for projects with Julia Computing, I’m very glad that it exists, because it hires many great people who might have had a hard time continuing to contribute to Julia (depending on where they go to work, or how busy they are).
